website_summaries.verdict: This rail works best with a standard-height mattress and box spring construction. Easily hidden when not in use.
pros: Slides under mattress when not in use
For use with mattress and box spring.Prevents gaps between rail and mattress
Rail slides under the mattress when not in use
Wash cover with a damp cloth and soap
Intended for mattress sizes up to queen, but customers have used it for king beds as well
cons: Installation instructions may be vague, so be sure to check the video instructions on Regalo's website

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for a king bed...
customer_reviews.text: I am currently sleeping in the middle of a king bed with a co sleeping infant on one side and occasional toddler sleeper on the other side. I was excited to find a extra long bed rail and bought two for both sides. I love it! Set both up tonight only took about a half hour by myself(with a toddler helper not doing much help) two people could put one together and set up in no time. Fits perfectly for a king bed and is a perfect length almost covers the whole side. Extremely happy and well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: 19Nicole20

customer_reviews.title: It's not the most beautiful thing, but it's reasonably high-quality and it keeps ...
customer_reviews.text: My geriatric dog has slept with me his entire life, so when he started falling off the foot of the bed in his sleep a few months ago, I couldn't bring myself to banish him to the floor. Instead, I ordered this and set it up lengthwise across the foot of my queen-sized mattress. It's not the most beautiful thing, but it's reasonably high-quality and it keeps my dog from hurting himself, which makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: OhEdith

customer_reviews.title: Not tall enough when you put the mattress down it
customer_reviews.text: I think its a good idea but its not tall enough. It need to be taller. After i put my mattress down on it, it was not tall enough. I have a pillow top mattress.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and attach to our king bed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and attach to our king bed. Not as easy to fold down under the mattress, but I'm lazy a lazy house keeper and mostly would not be folding it down anyway. Bought it to put on my side of the bed so our baby wouldn't be at risk of falling off in the middle of the night when I inevitably doze off while nursing, but there is a slight gap between the bed and the rail that would've nothing to a toddler, but which my newborn would definitely slip into. Stuffing it with rolled towels solved the problem. Keeping the rail as it serves my purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Wright

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, makes mattress uneven
customer_reviews.text: I want to like this bed rail because it was one of the few I could find with larger dimensions however I'm afraid it is a poor design. The "arms" of the rail sit between the mattress and boxspring. This is customary design. The problem is that the arms are not flat, they stand approx 2.5" tall. So when placed under the mattress they lift the mattress significantly in two areas causing the mattress to be uneven. I imagine over time it woukd damage the mattress. I can't recommend this product; not well thought out by the designers.
customer_reviews.author: T. Parent

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for long bed , rolling babies
customer_reviews.text: Ok just got it installed , took me a minute the directions were ehh , to save some trouble it should have just said alight the rails on the side and pull up on the top to secure it . So remember that lol But overall I think it's going to work perfect . It leans inward and you can put a lot of weight against it and it doesn't budge . Also I have it on a long and still tightened it up and had about 3-4 inches of slack on the cords .
customer_reviews.author: _Nurse007_

customer_reviews.title: I have a queen size bed (read review before purchasing)
customer_reviews.text: This product does not fit thick mattresses (look at uploaded picture). The barricade doesn't go up high enough. Also, if you're alone and don't have help then this product isn't for you unless you're strong enough. Reason being, it requires you to move your top mattress to connect the straps to your box spring. If you don't have a box spring then this product is also not for you. And I personally didn't like the instructions. I kind of figured it out on my own. Their video doesn't display the same product as what I got.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is possibly the worst thing ever purchased. It doesn't stay together well when you are trying to get it together to put on the bed, even laying the pieces on the bed. Once it was finally put together and on the bed with the mattress on top it leaned into the sleeping area so my daughter lost bed space and it doesn't fold down easily to slide under the mattress the way its supposed to. The whole thing fell apart and had to be reassembled. Needless to say it will be going back or in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: barbara

customer_reviews.title: Very poor design but keeps my kid in bed
customer_reviews.text: Works as described but very unhappy with design. The pictures do not show how large the posts are under the mattress. In order to use the rails u have to install slide rails under ur mattress. This allow u to "Hide" the rails if u wanted to. I have no reason to hide them and would of preferred a thinner rail under mattress. The rail is at least 2" thick so it is creating a large perememt indent in four places of the mattress. ( 2 rails purchases). also when I lay in the bed u can sometimes feel the rails under the mattress. Very poor design but keeps my kid in bed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: It fit fine (straps were totally long enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with our California king sized bed so my toddler wouldn’t roll off anymore. It fit fine (straps were totally long enough...not sure why this isn’t advertised as fitting king beds). I love that it easily folds down and slides under the mattress so that it doesn’t have to stay up all the time (very helpful for making the bed or just when you want the room to look nice). It is also very sturdy. My 2 1/2 year old climbs on it all the time and it’s holding up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Summer Goddard

customer_reviews.title: Hate it!
customer_reviews.text: This bed rail is horrible, it took forever to put together with terribly written instructions and once on the bed it leaned the mattress so my mom would roll towards the wall, it took two people to unlock and slide it down and it's so called hidden placement left it sticking out by 2 inches which would cause anyone trouble getting out of bed. Plus it left it's hinges sticking so far out it would cause tripping and bruised shins or faces depending on your height. Hate it!
customer_reviews.author: Tawnia Jones

customer_reviews.title: Open box perfection
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine as an "open box," and I rolled the dice. While packaged in an Amazon box, the original box was there and seemed to undamaged in any significant way. All the contents looked as though they were originally packed, too. I was missing nothing including directions. Those were easy to follow and assembly was simple. Installation is the hardest part because you have to lift up your mattress, but with two people (one lifting, the other putting the parts in place), it's much simpler. After some minor adjustments, the rail fits snugly to my 10' foam mattress and stows easily.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any age.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to keep my son in bed with me it has kept him in bed numerous times he tosses and turns all the time so this is perfect item for him from falling out of bed. My child has been using it everynight since he was 4 months old, an hes still using it (16months) great product, i dont have to worry about him rolling out of the bed. It literally covers the entire side of my bed.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: So, I bed share with my six month old due to his stomach problems and me needing sleep. It fits almost the entire length of my bed and is sturdy. Just have to make sure the security straps are nice and tight and you put the bar into the mattress a little bit. It was a little confusing to assemble at first, but it was well worth it considering the price and how sturdy it is. Note: my son also pulls up on it and it doesn’t budge. He enjoys this and I enjoy that he is safe doing so.
customer_reviews.author: Kiana Gagnon

customer_reviews.title: Not for thick mattresses
customer_reviews.text: If you have a thick mattress, this only leaves about 5 to 6 inches above the mattress. The picture on the box is very deceiving. Not enough in my eyes to keep children safely on the bed. I'm using it so my dogs don't roll off the side of the bed, which already happened and that's why I got this. It'll work fine for my purpose, but if you have a wild sleeping child, I wouldn't get this if you have a thick mattress. My son put it together very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Hungate

customer_reviews.title: Won't win any aesthetic awards, but keeps senior dog safely on the bed
customer_reviews.text: Like another reviewer, I installed this at the foot of my queen-sized bed to keep my elderly dog from rolling off in the middle of the night. It's a little clunky to put together, the stowaway function works but not perfectly, and it's not beautiful--the mesh looks cheap and there's a printed warning in big blue letters directly in my sightline--but this thing is functional in exactly the ways I'd hoped. The dog even likes snuggling against it, and I think it makes him feel more secure too. We all sleep better now.
customer_reviews.author: C-Jo

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product when it was on sale for 22$ I see the price went back up to 40 now however it is a good size easy assembly does the job it says it will. Only thing I would watch out for if you have a very mobile toddler is the metal bar can be hazardous if they like to roll into the guard this may just be because my mattress isnt very thick (10inch) and the bar pretty much meets with the top of the mattress but besides that good product.
customer_reviews.author: Med

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Product don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: This product is poorly designed as it has no real anchoring system. It's very flimsy the rails that the guard sits on stick out too far, the anchoring straps are flimsy week and tear apart easily. Rails of this product shift too much that causes the guard to bind up. I would not recommend this product to anyone and it's definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Hutcheson

customer_reviews.title: Great rail, bad hideaway!
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is extra long and almost reaches the length of the twin bed, but I hate the hideaway feature! It lifts the mattress up about 2 inches on the side of the rail and it's not that easy to pop up and down, so we just keep ours up. I don't think my son notices on the top of the mattress, but I see the hardware from the edge of the bed and just really don't like it!
customer_reviews.author: Delaina

customer_reviews.title: Daughter fell because it was only half locked, security flaw
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product outside of the fact that you need to be sure to pull on it once it is up to verify that it is fully locked in. It wasn’t once and my daughter fell out of bed and was hanging onto it for dear life while still in bed. Also be sure to lift up on the back end while pushing in with your legs to get it to go under the bed, there’s a little divet that it falls into and won’t let you make it hide under the bed otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: We bought two, one for each side of a full size bed for our two year old. With some manipulation, we made it work. They have been in place for 6 months, and we are happy with them. We leave them up all the time and don’t make the bed. Our daughter likes to sleep against them. I have leaned against it while sleeping in her bed. It is very sturdy. We put a step stool on one side of her bed near the footboard, so she can get out if she needs to. We pile pillows on the other side so she isn’t tempted to go that way and fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: It broke the first time we used it
customer_reviews.text: After installation, we went to pull it down to put the sheets on the bed, and the white part that unlocks the rail wouldn't look again. Now every time our son leans on it, the lock pops up and that part of the rail tips out. We can't use it anymore. Contacted the manufacturer and they told us to return it to Amazon to get a new one and that they didn't have a fix. To be honest it was so much trouble to install that I don't really want to go through it all again. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Greentea503

customer_reviews.title: a pain to assemble
customer_reviews.text: this guard should have been easy to assemble. The connections however didn't slide in as the instructions inferred, and I could not successfully put the guard together. It's now unusable. Several others tried to help me and came to the same conclusion- some of the fittings were just slap too tight to slide together properly. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Gaye Clark

customer_reviews.title: easiest device to set up; however, not the easiest to use.
customer_reviews.text: The rails sitting under the mattress must be checked for alignment daily before each use. The device comes with 2 side rails that allow the rail with the netting to be folded and tucked underneath the mattress can be frustrating to push in or pull out. the weight and flexibility of the mattress will affect it. when a person is lying on the mattress. After adding a bar between the rails at the opposite end, alignment improved. Users should be aware that your bed sheets will get caught in the hinges on both sides of the safety rail {with the netting} and can lead to side rail not locking in place.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: It's nice
customer_reviews.text: I do like the product. It was easy to put together and set in place. My only complaint would be or maybe just me not paying attention is I have a thick mattress . I bought this for my granddaughter who is visiting me for a while. The product is definitely long enough but not wide enough. I have about 4 inches showing from my mattress to the top of this protector.
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Works well, wish there was a travel case included.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. I have one of these attached to the bed to keep my youngest from falling out & I’ve used it for 3 years. It works well & has kept her safe. The other one I take on vacations. It’s been a life saver! Putting it up/taking it down has resulted in some bent metal. But that’s probably to be expected. I REALLY, REALLY wish it came with a travel-type case though. Doesn’t need to be a hard case, just something to keep all the parts in.
customer_reviews.author: C. Miguez

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, I’m normally pretty good at putting things together but this confused me a bit but I got it after watching a YouTube video. My 4 year old recently fell and broke her collarbone so I purchased this so she wouldn’t fall out of bed and further injure it, it’s sturdy and cute! It was a bit to figure out the best placement as she has a bunk bed but I did it and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Motley

customer_reviews.title: Needs better description of the support rails thickness.
customer_reviews.text: The support rails that go under the mattress are 2 inches thick and cause the head and foot to raise up. This causes a sag in the middle. I didn't even finish the installation knowing this would ruin my new mattress. I'm going to try this one instead: "Summer Infant Double Safety Bedrail, Grey" the under rails look thinner and shouldn't lift the mattress as much. Edit: The double bedrail has much thinner cross bars and does not lift the mattress, I'm glad i returned this one!
customer_reviews.author: A Fisch

customer_reviews.title: Not useable on the intended bed.
customer_reviews.text: I liked how easy the unit assembles. However installation is another story. After wrestling with it for an hour I finally flipped to the fine print section of the instructions to figure out what I’m doing wrong. I find where it says this unit will not work with platform bed, and will not work with inflatable mattress. We have both. I think I’ve figured a way around the platform problem however getting the unit to stow away while someone is sitting on the bed is still a problem. :( at least it was cheap
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Safety first
customer_reviews.text: Safety first. I have an adult son with special needs and we put this on his bed so he doesn’t roll out. This is a great value it last for years this is the second one we bought I think we’ve had the other one for at least five years. This is great on a full-size bed also which is what he has
customer_reviews.author: phxbbw6ft1

customer_reviews.title: Keeps your kiddo in but doesn’t hide away
customer_reviews.text: Works to keep your kid in however neither myself nor my very strong husband can get this to “hide away” which was half the point in purchasing it (hence the half star rating). We followed the instructions to put it together though they’re a bit vague I even watched a video on their site but no dice. So it’s difficult to get my son INTO the bed because of it. But he’s large for 3 and it goes down nearly the whole length of his bed so we feel safer with him in it.
customer_reviews.author: Ry A.

customer_reviews.title: So far good.
customer_reviews.text: I set up the guard rail last night. Not hard to assemble. It worked great for my son. His bed has wooden slabs at the bottom instead of a box spring. I made it work. Only part of this product I did not like was legs that go under the mattress are not flat, they are raised making the mattress go up a little. Other than that it seems to be a good product. Now we need to see how long it last. Seems sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly for what I needed it for. I wanted a bed rail on one side of my queen bed for when my 18 month old wants to watch tv with me. But I love that this folds down out of the way when he is not in my room. It was a little confusing to put together but once it’s together it was easy to install and has been working great for us.
customer_reviews.author: Sadie Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Really nice
customer_reviews.text: This is really, really nice. Nicer than I thought it’d be actually. The only reason I took off a star is bec sometimes it pops off the tracks initially when you first click it to go down, but if you just slide it under gently it shouldn’t be an issue. I’m really happy to have bought this. I love how it stores under the mattress and is long enough to reach across the whole side. Easy to take down.
customer_reviews.author: Marcy

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this product based on my experience.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic locking device broke before assembly. Metal pins did not align with holes without great effort and bending. Using this as a safety guard rail for my elderly mother do she doesn’t roll out of bed. Could not operate the hideaway feature which is why I bought it. Using it on the other side of the bed In a permanently raised position.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the sturdiest
customer_reviews.text: We got it so a child taking a nap could lay safely but if that child is little they could top right over it. A tad flimsy so just make sure they understand not to lean on it. We do have it anchored and haven't had an issue but I just dont feel like it's sturdy enough.
customer_reviews.author: Believe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for bedsharing
customer_reviews.text: We are currently using this on our king size bed because we bedshare with our 13 month old son. We use it to keep him from rolling out of the bed since I am currently sleeping between him and my husband. He’s only ever in the bed when we’re sleeping together so I can’t say about safety if child is left in bed alone. Works perfectly for what we need it for and was super easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Kainan + Novalee’s Mom

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok. Not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Not as smart a design as the ones we had growing up in the 60’s and 70’s. It took us a while to figure out how to use the strap around the mattress. There’s too much of a gap between the mattress and the item itself. Our eight month old granddaughter slipped through it when she was weighing about maybe 12 to 15 pounds at that time. We do like how it folds down so we can make the bed over the top of it and no one can tell.
customer_reviews.author: Active Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Very secure
customer_reviews.text: With 3 kids at home I don't have much room, and finding a railing that was strong and tall enough for my 3 year old was a challenge! but I found it ... I had to tie a couple of knots to make it secure. I am satisfied even though I could not get the railing to bend, to get it under the mattress, my girl, she found a way to get out easily. I recommend it and despite the fact that the bed is metal, the railing is very secure, and I like the idea that it fits in a full bed. lasos are long enough
customer_reviews.author: Zuleymath

customer_reviews.title: But the product was made well and quite sturdy and length is much better than short one
customer_reviews.text: It only gets a 3 because it does NOT FIT A BUNK BED! It won't slide under as bunks have a 2 inch lip and it won't lay flat. No matter what others write DO NOT PURCHASE IF IT'S FOR A BUNK BED... One report said it DOES fit so I took a chance....:( Now I need to get a box to send back as I threw out the Amazon box.....But the product was made well and quite sturdy and length is much better than short one.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy K.

customer_reviews.title: Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: We've bought two of these over the years for the kids and have found them to be an essential baby/toddler item. Kept the little ones from rolling out of bed at night. The cover fits snugly (as it should), which can make it difficult to remove and replace, but I'd rather have it that way than super loose. Definitely money well spent and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: E. Ronakov

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Reliable Rail
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly as described. Purchased to add to queen bed to co-sleep with toddler and this product is for sure a quality product. I've had the rail in place for over a year, works perfectly and has exceeded my expectations. Easy to put together, install, and of course to use.
customer_reviews.author: Lady A

customer_reviews.title: Would purchase over and over!!
customer_reviews.text: This product was better than described and pictured!!! We have a full size slatted bed frame with no box spring for my two year old daughter and this product worked PERFECT!!! The pink color is so cute and went with her room theme which I didn’t even realize I purchased a color! The shipping was SUPER fast as it had said it would take about a week or so with regular (free shipping) and my product arrived in 3 days! Packaging was great and it was easy to assemble! It is so convenient because it folds and hides under the mattress! Absolutely invaluable! Thank you so much for a great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Giggly_Me

customer_reviews.title: Great price and product.
customer_reviews.text: Goes very well with my daughter’s bed. Built sturdy at a great price. The quality of the material is better then the ones available at the stores. Wipes up clean and easy to assemble. I no longer have the fear of her rolling out of her bed at night.
customer_reviews.author: Julius

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use with memory foam mattress.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely do NOT recommend anything about this. I hate how it sits on my sons bed, it is extremely crooked, and his mattress sits extremely high up now. I can’t hid it away easily because it gets caught on the mattress. I was hopeful I’d love this design and I unfortunately hate this bed rail.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful piece of equipment!!
customer_reviews.text: Best product yet for bed rollers. My 6 yr old Grandson is one. He fell out of the bed once and that’s all it took for me to go searching for a product that would protect him from never doing this again!! It is well made that met all my expectations. Believe me it has saved him many times now from falling out of bed since I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my mother in laws house for when my two year old stays over night. They have a twin bed pushed up against the wall with a headboard and footboard. We used this for the open side. It's secure and long enough to keep him from rolling out of bed and there is just enough room between this rail and the footboard for him to climb out on his own when he wakes up. It's exactly what we were looking for, and it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Makes mattress uneven
customer_reviews.text: The arms in this thing are over 2 inches high. When you put the mattress back down, the side with the rail is so much higher than the other. I would return, but I’ve already gotten rid of the box. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: clarrissa

customer_reviews.title: Not for platform bed!!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I didn’t read the description close enough but this doesn’t work with a platform style bed. You must have a box spring to use this item. The item wasn’t overly difficult to put together but the locking / unlocking was not clearly stated within the instructions - I found this confusing. I’m unable to use this item.
customer_reviews.author: Colton T. Mylet

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and does its job!
customer_reviews.text: This railing is wonderful. We bought this for our daughter's twin sized bed and its perfect. It leaves enough room for her to get in and out of the bed, but not enough that she will roll out. The installation of it was very simple and the directions were easy to understand. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: IndieMommy

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for platform bed and futon mattress but still works
customer_reviews.text: We did not purchase a regular box spring and coil mattress. We have a platform bed and a futon mattress for our son. This is not ideal for that but it had great reviews and a great price so we had to make some adjustments. We purchased a piece of plywood to put on top of the slates of the bed and we are unable to use the hiding feature without lifting his extremely heavy 8" futon mattress. in any case he will not roll of the bed so I have piece of mind while he is alone sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Morales

customer_reviews.title: I knew he liked to roll so I decided to try this product
customer_reviews.text: My son is 2 years old and wild! He knew how to climb out his crib before he turned 1. We decided to get him a big boy bed that was twin size. I knew he liked to roll so I decided to try this product. It was a bed with flats instead of a box spring. I figured a way to rig this product to make it work between the slats. It's awesome! Be gentle while pulling the cover over the the railing so it won't bust the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Only use with a boxspring, might want to buy some zip ties.
customer_reviews.text: This might work well for beds with boxsprings, but my sons bed is memory foam, the weight of that is not enough to keep the part that runs underneath still. It comes loose and the whole thing wants to fall off. We had to buy heavy duty zip ties and zip tie it to the frame of the bed. Then, after a few nights of my son (he's 4) sleeping with it and leaning on it, the part that lets you recline it broke so the whole thing collapsed and he fell out of bed. We had to zip tie it to itself to hold it up. Very annoying! Works well now that it's zip tied though!
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy bed rail but don't bother trying to use the "hide away" option.
customer_reviews.text: This bed rail works awesome. It leans in close to the bed and has the ability to tighten as much as you want. I would give it five stars but when I tried to use the lock mechanism to put it down I ended up just completely bending the bars that hold it up so it didn't work anymore. I had to order another. I didn't bother even attempting to put it down the second time around but it does it's job.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Must use a box spring or sheet of wood under mattress
customer_reviews.text: I have a trundle bed where the mattress sits on top of a metal frame with just bars supporting it. This bed guard does not fit well and keeps sliding off the metal bars. Now it is obvious it has to have a solid support underneath to work but I did not read or get this information before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Crown Jul

customer_reviews.title: This bed rail works great once installed properly
customer_reviews.text: This bed rail works great once installed properly. My 2 year old sometimes moves around in bed and has slept up against this railing several times and it has always stayed in place. This gives a mom comfort at night. We have a trundle bed and had to buy a piece of plywood to "fill in" the metal frame so it would be level under the mattress, the way a box spring automatically would be level. Now the mattress sits on top of the wood and the bedrail straps. After we did this, the product worked perfectly and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I had been recommended to purchase this product for when we went camping and rented a pop up camper. It didn't work for the area I wanted it to but it did work on one of the pull out sides. The issue is that I then had to share the side with my toddler who didn't sleep as well as she would have in her own bed. Fit issues aside the cover that goes over the top seems sturdy but it tore near the seams after one night. I ended up returning this product and will search for another solution for our next trip.
customer_reviews.author: CSoegaard

customer_reviews.title: Very much needed.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Fit very well on top bunk for my daughter. She started sleeping up top and I got scared of her falling. This works perfect to prevent that and ease my worries.
customer_reviews.author: Rae ThatsME

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Pain in the butt to initially set up but we have had it for over a year now and it has been wonderful. We put it on when our daughter turned two and started in her big girl bed and she’s now three and half and still uses it. Will buy again for second child
customer_reviews.author: Kelley E.

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE!!
customer_reviews.text: It sucks. If it falls out of line in the slightest, you cannot collapse it. It mounts via rails between the mattress and box spring, so if it's on an adjustable bed, just forget it. It's the worst product I've ever gotten for my invalid mother. Her caregivers are pulling their hair out over it. It WAS CHEAP, in in every sense of the word. DO NOT buy this bed rail, or you'll be sorry. But hey, it arrived on time and it was easy to assemble. That was the only good experience. Amazon always comes through on their part in it, but DON'T buy this piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: SIDW

customer_reviews.title: I'm 54 years old and was having a terrible time of falling out of bed
customer_reviews.text: This bed rail has been a lifesaver for me. I'm 54 years old and was having a terrible time of falling out of bed. We didn't want to spend too much, but I didn't want to risk any more falls. My husband keeps asking me if I want it off. I keep telling him I've woke up too close to the edge and we'd better leave it on.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Broke during installation
customer_reviews.text: Fits on king bed the length is great doesn’t creat a gap The locking buckle snapped off while I was tightening the straps.....it seems ok with out it being tightened so I guess I’m just gonna leave it like that I might return it Both pieces of the buckel that were keeping it in snapped off very easily
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Originally bought this for my bed for niece visits. Ended up giving it to my mom for the same use, my niece. Love it so much! Will now buy one for me again lol
customer_reviews.author: Joyce M Rubio

customer_reviews.title: Overall has been Great
customer_reviews.text: Overall the rail does its job. I find the "hideaway" function difficult to slide in and out, however that could likely be because I'm using this for a 130lb adult instead of a child, so with him lying on the bed, that could be what's making it hard to slide out. I usually have to brace the bed with one foot and pull. Other than that it's been a nice sturdy rail and the extra long feature was a must for us, because my recently disabled father is an escape artist.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Great and safe product, won't last too long, as the structure can be bent if your kids hang on it
customer_reviews.text: Ok this is a good product, nonetheless their is a need to caution parents that the bed rail is safe only if your kid does not monkey around and attempt to climb this daily while pulling it. Over time this will cause the rail to bend, and no longer be upright. If you are like me, you then force it back and bend it back upright. Realistically l, I can't imagine ever passing this down from one kid to the next. Not sure of other products but I would buy something more durable, too late for me as I bought this for both of my kids.
customer_reviews.author: Giuseppe B

customer_reviews.title: Wish it didnt have a hump
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rail for our third child. the video had me sold. However, as its assembled, the arms that go under the mattress, are so thick, it leaves humps in the bed where they are. Very eye soring even with the bed made. Only thing keeping me from sending it back is that its super sturdy, at least its only a 2 year old sleeping on the bed and fits in the middle of the humps. Great concept and design, but not quite executed right
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with a Queen Bed
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this to use with our queen bed when we started bedsharing with our daughter. It works great for that purpose; the straps are more than long enough to stretch under a queen bed, and the rail comes up high enough to be safe even with a tall mattress (we have a Tempurpedic). Installation was easy and it slides under the mattress easily. We've been using it for 4 or 5 months now and it's still going strong -- we have not had any problems with it. I feel much safer having our daughter in our bed knowing that she can't roll out of it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 of these, one I took it to Colombia and left it at grannies for future vacation!!! So that means its light weight and easy to store when needed. I like it a lot because my 3 year old needs something to keep her in the bed, she moves a lot! I clean it with a bit of soup and paper towels... looks like new!
customer_reviews.author: jessica2

customer_reviews.title: Comes off too easily
customer_reviews.text: I like this bedrail for the most part. My only complaint is that the edges don't go down far enough. So if you're making the bed it only takes a small bump and it's off the bed and you have to re-strap it down. It becomes very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Werrline

customer_reviews.title: Still does its job- sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: We've now been using this for over a year and it is still working exactly as advertised/expected. My now almost 4yr old is pretty active/busy and I was worried it wouldn't be sturdy enough to keep her safe as she transferred from crib to big bed but it's still working perfectly with her a year older/year "bigger" and I feel secure with her in the big bed using this rail. We did not have any problem putting this together or getting it on the bed securely, we opened the box, had it put together and on the bed in under 30min. Would order this again and recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: hokiemommy35

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't buy another hideaway
customer_reviews.text: It never sat right on the twin bed, it lifted the bottom corner up. Also, slid away from the bed easily and everyday no matter how tight the straps were I had to push it back up against the mattress, meaning my little one could have fallen in between at night. Also, my little one is rough and easily broke the feature to roll under the bed, which in turn means there is no support to hold it against the mattress, I ended up having to throw away after 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Not dependable
customer_reviews.text: This is a poorly designed metal framed but non-sturdy product. Not like the picture for sure. The surface under the mattress has to be above the side rails of the bed, period. A lot of straps, rails and frames to navigate through to use it. Not easy plug-in plug out type apparatus.
customer_reviews.author: SYED A.

customer_reviews.title: Clunky and causes a big bump under the mattress
customer_reviews.text: This is not smooth to slide in and out, you have to click it/adjust it exactly perfectly on both sides. My husband still has not gotten the hang of it. When you hide it away, it causes a big bump/slope on the mattress. Not worth it- just get a permanent one and stick it under the bed or in the closet when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: JJBee91

customer_reviews.title: Great bed rail
customer_reviews.text: I have a 14 year old Lab who has been sleeping in my bed all her life,, She has bad arthritis, and was starting to roll off the bed,, This bed rail was perfect, and in the morning i just slide it in between the mattress and box spring.. good product, easy use and reasonable price...
customer_reviews.author: bevnick

customer_reviews.title: Received it damaged
customer_reviews.text: The frame was bent and did not feel secure. I tried to install it and it was still sliding up and down without locking into place. Could not trust to have my little one next to it since it was moving that much
customer_reviews.author: walter g.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for its intended purpose whatsoever!
customer_reviews.text: No long enough and not high enough... I bought it because I thought it looked better than the alternative bed guard but my son PAINFULLY fell out of his bed multiple times in a one week span with this product. It may look better but it doesn't protect my son so I will be switching. In fact the fact that its a pillow basically makes me think it made my son more likely to fall out because in his sleep he would migrate over to this guard as a pillow and end up snuggling it till he eventually fell out. Not good. And my sons 4.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: General comment about these items is they are kind of a pain to instal and get alighned right while putting the mattress on the bed.This is not unique to this particular item. That being said, specific to this item, if you don't read the directions when snapping it together it's very hard to take back apart. This is great for safety and stability of the final product, not so great if you rushed into snapping it together to fast. The roll away feature is an added bonus, especially if your child doesn't need the guard rail all the time. I WOULD recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: TJCounihan

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. Good for dogs or humans.
customer_reviews.text: We actually bought 2 panels for our elderly dog. She would walk around the bed or wake up in the middle of the night and fall off the bed onto the hard floor. We plan to use this for our kids. And quite possibly for our parents down the road. Easy to assemble and very sturdy. Would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but...
customer_reviews.text: It took a few looks to get my head around the installation [not like the other model that doesn't slide under the mattress], but once it got sorted out, it's higher than the other non-sliding model by a few inches, so gives more protection. Seems rather durable so far.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Safe!
customer_reviews.text: We love it other than there is quite a gap between the mattresses and it is noticeable. But it has great locking features and there is no doubt your kiddo or loved one will be safe!
customer_reviews.author: Devyn

customer_reviews.title: Great for those who cosleep
customer_reviews.text: This works very well for those who cosleep. This rail fits up to a king size bed, no problem. It was very easy to put together and install on the bed. There was only one part of the instructions that I could not figure out, but it does not effect the functionality of the rail. We have a pillow top king size bed, and the rail fits well with the pillow top. The rail feels very sturdy. I did not notice an odor as a previous reviewer mentioned. The fabric was also pretty well made unlike a previous review. The fabric in this box was not fraying and did not have any imperfections.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Working well, keeping toddler safe in bed
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 of these, one on each side of our 2 yr old's bed. They fit very snugly to the mattress, which is obviously a good thing. We don't have to worry about her getting her head stuck in between the rail and the mattress. The mechanism to lower the sides is easy to figure out, but difficult to do if you can't reach both sides at once (again, a good thing since our toddler is pretty good at figuring out mechanical things). Sliding the rail beneath the mattress to "hide away" is tough as the weight of the mattress kind of blocks it, but it would be doable if we needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah A.

customer_reviews.title: just what we need
customer_reviews.text: fits our king sized mattress on a platform bed, my 19mo co-sleeps and it works great to keep her snug in our bed, and she'll roll right up against it sometimes, it's very sturdy and easy to slide in between our platform and mattress. if you have a platform it will scratch it, fyi. we don't really care, so this isn't a concern of ours
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Pulsifer

customer_reviews.title: Takes two people to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I actually returned this because it takes two people to put it on a bed that's not a twin. I wanted it on a queen size and I can't lift the mattress up and over the rail mechanism without dislodging it. It might work great if there are two people to set it up but I'm just one. Obviously I can't speak to how well it does it's job once installed.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie

customer_reviews.title: Best for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Good for the first couple months for a baby sleeping in a bassinet/nest, but around month 5-6, or whenever your baby starts to stand by holding onto the rail, it's dangerous. I put the rail on my bed and let him lay there or play supervised when he was unable to stand. Now I will save it to use for his toddler bed when the time comes. I would recommend for toddler use.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Got for RV overhead sleeper
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use on the overhead sleeper cabin in an RV, it worked out great. The straps that go underneath the mattress are adjustable. We tried it on our bed at home just to see how it fit- we have a very deep pocketed mattress with built in memory foam pillow top- and the railing barely peeked over the top by about 2 or 3 inches. If you have a really thick mattress I'd recommend foam bumpers instead. But it did slide back under the mattress out of sight. 5 stars for what we needed it for!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: I love this rail
customer_reviews.text: I love this rail. I have not had any issues and I feel much better about my toddler sleeping in the bed with me. I have a queen size bed and it worked great. I never take it off though because while it isn't "hard" to put back on, it is a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended! Great product i have purchased. Quick shipping, easy to install and great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: ferdi

customer_reviews.title: love the safety
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit hard to set up, but it is great comfort knowing my child is safe and will not roll off the bed and hit the hard wood floors. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Granmama Lorelai

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. We plan to purchase more. This one fits a king size bed, both side and end, as we had to work out a sleeping arrangement for our littles. They dont move when in place. Kids cannot fall between the rail and bed. The perfect solution.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Just get bumpers. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Strap anchors do not stay secure no matter now tight you ohkk them. Bars under mattress sit so high there is a raised "bump" in the top and bottom of the mattress. Really poorly designed and I effective product.
customer_reviews.author: Ian W.

customer_reviews.title: I love that it collapses and tucks away for making the ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this at the end of our King bed for our dogs. They have a sense of safety as they lay at the end of the bed and stretch out. I love that it collapses and tucks away for making the bed. Great invention for being able to collapse and store between the mattresses
customer_reviews.author: stephanie lagow

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our daughter's first big girl bed. I put it together pretty easily and didn't have any problem with attaching it to the bed. It has saved our daughter from falling in the middle of the night out of her day bed. The only problem I have with it is the storage aspect of it. Since the day bed has a set of springs underneath it and not another mattress you can't store it easily because it catches on the springs. I'm sure for a full size bed with two mattresses that wouldn't be a problem though. It is a nice rail and I would recommend it anyone looking to save their children from a fall.
customer_reviews.author: L. Neel

customer_reviews.title: Speedy shipping but lacks quality
customer_reviews.text: Only 3 stars because once installed with the mattress set into place, the two sliding rails create a bow in the matress leaving your head/neck and legs/feet higher than your midsection/torso.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jobe

customer_reviews.title: Good bed rail
customer_reviews.text: Me and my husband installed this bed rail a month ago to a queen sized bed. I use it sometimes when I sleep with my son who is 13 months old. It is really good quality for the low price. It has no chemical odor and the cover can be washed easily. It was easy to install. My only complaint is that it wiggles a little. I wish it was more tight; however I can't compare it with other bed rails, since this is my first one. I would recommend this to anyone for transitioning toddler from crib to regular bed, or for occasional co-sleeping with younger children.
customer_reviews.author: V. Rivera

customer_reviews.title: poor product
customer_reviews.text: product came damaged and regalo has poor customer service and refused to repair the product when it was only 60 days old.
customer_reviews.author: Billy C.

customer_reviews.title: Great engineering
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! My toddler sleeps in my king sized bed with me and has rolled off of the foot of the bed a couple of times. This rail isn’t quite as high as I had hoped but it still appears to do the job of keeping her from rolling out. Assembly was easy and pretty straight forward with the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Msrebecca212

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: The length is perfect for a twin bed. Toddler was very safe. This was her first time in a big bed. It was fairly easy to assemble and fits good a tight. The fold down feature was great.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to install. We have aging dogs we don't want to fall out of the bed and get hurt. This helps prevent that and so far so good. Cheaper than paying large vet bills.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Wissel

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect with our king size bed, the weight of the mattress holds the rail in place. Our 15 month old is very interested in it and climbs it up but we can deal with that. The most important thing is we sleep worry-free at night.
customer_reviews.author: Tyna
